entry.title: Quotient of Gaussian Densities
entry.content:
Statement

Let $p$ and $q$ denote Gaussian pdfs with the form

egin{align} p(x) &= Z_p^{-1} \exp\left( - rac{1}{2} (x-\mu_p)\T \Sigma_p^{-1} (x-\mu_p) ight) ewline q(x) &= Z_q^{-1} \exp\left( - rac{1}{2} (x-\mu_q)\T \Sigma_q^{-1} (x-\mu_q) ight) \end{align}

Our goal is to show that the quotient $ rac{p(x)}{q(x)}$ takes the form

egin{equation} rac{p(x)}{q(x)} = w^{-1} \exp \left( - rac{1}{2} (x - \mu)\T \Sigma^{-1} (x-\mu) ight) \end{equation}

where egin{align} \Sigma &\coloneqq (\Sigma_p^{-1} - \Sigma_q^{-1})^{-1} ewline \mu &\coloneqq \Sigma (\Sigma_p^{-1} \mu_p - \Sigma_q^{-1} \mu_q) ewline w^{-1} &\coloneqq rac{ \lvert \Sigma_p vert^{ rac{1}{2}} }{ \lvert \Sigma_p vert^{ rac{1}{2}} } \exp\left(- rac{1}{2} \Big[ \mu_p\T \Sigma_p^{-1} \mu_p - \mu_q\T \Sigma_q^{-1} - \mu\T \Sigma^{-1} \mu \Big] ight) \end{align}

Note that $ rac{p(x)}{q(x)}$ is not normalized and hence is not necessarily a probability density function.

Derivation

We first note the formula for completing the square:

egin{equation} rac{1}{2} x\T P x - q\T x = rac{1}{2} (x - P^{-1} q)\T P (x - P^{-1} q) - rac{1}{2} q\T P^{-1} q \end{equation}

Now,

egin{align} &\mathrel{\phantom{=}} rac{1}{2} (x - \mu_p)\T \Sigma_p^{-1} (x - \mu_p) - rac{1}{2} (x - \mu_q)\T \Sigma_q^{-1} (x - \mu_q) ewline &= rac{1}{2} x\T (\Sigma_p^{-1} - \Sigma_q^{-1}) x - (\Sigma_p^{-1} \mu_p - \Sigma_q^{-1} \mu_q)\T x + rac{1}{2} \mu_p\T \Sigma_p^{-1} \mu_p - rac{1}{2} \mu_q\T \Sigma_q^{-1} \mu_q \end{align} \shortintertext{Defining $m \coloneqq \Sigma_p^{-1} \mu_p - \Sigma_q^{-1} \mu_q$ and $\Sigma$ as above,} egin{align} &= rac{1}{2} x\T \Sigma^{-1} x - m\T x + rac{1}{2} \mu_p\T \Sigma_p^{-1} \mu_p - rac{1}{2} \mu_q\T \Sigma_q^{-1} \mu_q ewline &= rac{1}{2} (x - \mu)\T \Sigma^{-1} (x - \mu) - rac{1}{2} \mu\T \Sigma^{-1} \mu + rac{1}{2} \mu_p\T \Sigma_p^{-1} \mu_p - rac{1}{2} \mu_q\T \Sigma_q^{-1} \mu_q ewline &= rac{1}{2} \Big[ (x - \mu)\T \Sigma^{-1} (x - \mu) + \mu_p\T \Sigma_p^{-1} \mu_p - \mu_q\T \Sigma_q^{-1} - \mu\T \Sigma^{-1} \mu \Big] \end{align}

Finally,

egin{align} rac{ p(x) }{ q(x) } &= rac{ \lvert \Sigma_q vert^{ rac{1}{2}} }{ \lvert \Sigma_p vert^{ rac{1}{2}} } \exp\left( - rac{1}{2} \Big[ (x - \mu_p)\T \Sigma_p^{-1} (x - \mu_p) - (x - \mu_q)\T \Sigma_q^{-1} (x - \mu_q) \Big] ight) ewline &= rac{ \lvert \Sigma_q vert^{ rac{1}{2}} }{ \lvert \Sigma_p vert^{ rac{1}{2}} } \exp\left(- rac{1}{2} \Big[ (x - \mu)\T \Sigma^{-1} (x - \mu) + \mu_p\T \Sigma_p^{-1} \mu_p - \mu_q\T \Sigma_q^{-1} - \mu\T \Sigma^{-1} \mu \Big] ight) ewline &= w^{-1} \exp\left( - rac{1}{2} (x - \mu)\T \Sigma^{-1} (x - \mu) ight) \end{align}

where

egin{equation} w^{-1} \coloneqq rac{ \lvert \Sigma_q vert^{ rac{1}{2}} }{ \lvert \Sigma_p vert^{ rac{1}{2}} } \exp\left(- rac{1}{2} \Big[ \mu_p\T \Sigma_p^{-1} \mu_p - \mu_q\T \Sigma_q^{-1} - \mu\T \Sigma^{-1} \mu \Big] ight) \end{equation}
entry.summary: Quick derivation of quotient of Gaussian densities so it's somewhere.
